zone.line: the midst of festival & ?rejoin solemn joy
his
with thousands & thousands of inslaved &
desolated species chained behind his chariot
exhibiting, as circumstances of glory titles
to renown, the labour of ages & the admired
creations of genius overthrown by the brutal
force ?under ?his which was placed as a sword
within his hand; and, contemplations fearful
& abhorred! he himself, a being capable of
the gentlest & best emotions, inspired with
the persuasion that he has done a virtuous
deed -. We forget not these things
Orsino
I thought to act a solemn comedy
Upon the painted stage scene of this new world
But
Nay if this be heresy
Then Martin Luther was a Catholic . . . .
Let the church bear the failings of her sons
